thread.title: Coach K to leave U.S. national post in 2016
thread.title_full: Coach K to leave U.S. national post in 2016

title: Coach K to leave U.S. national post in 2016
text:
Coach K to leave U.S. national post in 2016 Oct. 19, 2015 10:23 p.m. Rick Wood Duke coach Mike Krzyzewski 
Duke coach Mike Krzyzewski will step down from his position as the head coach of U.S. men's national team after the 2016 Olympics. 
"It definitely is," Krzyzewski told ESPN about this being his last stint as head coach with USA Basketball. "I think it's time to move ahead." 
In the 10 years he has served as the national team's head coach, Krzyzewski has a record of 75-1, winning gold in 2008 in Beijing and 2012 in London. The team's only loss came to Greece in the semifinals of the 2006 FIBA World Championship. Krzyzewski, 68, led the team to the 2010 world championship and the 2014 World Cup as well. During his tenure, the NBA's best players have returned to the national team, as opposed to skipping out on international competitions. Â© 2015 , Journal Sentinel Inc. All rights reserved.
